subject: Re: [junit] JUnit html report
msgSnippet: ... What are you using to build your code with? Does that provide an integration with junit in such a way that reports can be easily produced? Cheers, James
messageBody:
On 15/10/2007, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> Ibrahim,
>
> Ant is the simplest way I know to get an HTML report. There's also
> JUnit Factory's free dashboard, if your code is freely licensed.
> Once you've decided on a simple reporting tool to use, that will
> affect what kind of complicated configuration you'll need to do to
> report your SOA stats. Thanks,
>
> David
>
> On 10/15/07, ibrahim demir <ibrahimdemire@...> wrote:
> > Hi All;
> >
> > I need to create a html report for my junit tests. Is there a simple and easy way other than http://ant.apache.org/manual/OptionalTasks/junit.html this one.
> >
> > Or a tool that will generate a report after running all tests. I asked for that because i just want to see a simple report and making such configurations is an over-head for me. Is there a simple or an easy way you can recommend?
> >

What are you using to build your code with? Does that provide an
integration with junit in such a way that reports can be easily
produced?

Cheers,

James
